Description: Rim and neck fragment from a black-figured pottery stirrup krater with broad flat ledge rim; root of handle preserved at left break just under rim. On exterior a swan to left with rosettes in field. On top of rim, a meander; band of rectangles on edge of lip. Interior glazed with one band of added white-red-white. Clay beige brown, some mica.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 223, no. 98)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 108. pl. XXXIV, no. 319.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.302)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4702 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
